```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
## attach libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(readxl)
library(here) #install.packages('skimr')
library(skimr)
library(kableExtra)  #install.packages('kableExtra')
```
```{r}
## read in data
lobsters <- read_xlsx(here("data/lobsters.xlsx"), skip=4)
# explore data
skimr::skim(lobsters) 
#you get the same thing if you exclude "skimr::". It is simply an annotation to show where skim() is from.
```
```{r}
#Now we take our data, group by year and summarize by count.
lobsters %>%
  group_by(year) %>%
  summarize(count_by_year = n())
#our own lil pivot table!
```
